value.title: Prioritize your issues and apply security controls
value.excerpt: Threat modeling provides you with a list of threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk, but it doesn't prioritize them for you. Also, there are no layered security control recommendations based on their type and function.

value.title: Use recommended tools to create a data-flow diagram
value.excerpt: You can use any canvas, physical or virtual, to create a data-flow diagram. Engineers at Microsoft recommend three tools to help you in your threat modeling journey.

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Olivier Bloch joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure IoT and how it is more than just about connecting IoT devices and sending telemetry to the Cloud. They also talk about Azure IoT device topics such as twins, provisioning, and lifecycle management.  For more information, see:  Azure IoT Hub - http://aka.ms/azureiotgetstarted
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/smuZaZZXKsU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Deploy a pre-built module to the Edge device
Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
value.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

value.title: Build an Azure Digital Twins graph for a chocolate factory production line
value.excerpt: This module covers the first steps in building an Azure Digital Twins solution. The units cover making an instance of Azure Digital Twins, and learning about, creating, and visualizing, DTDL models. You will create, validate, graph, and query, models for a chocolate factory production line.

value.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
value.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Create your first route finding app with Azure Maps
value.excerpt: Learn about writing code to interact with Azure Maps. Develop and test a fun app using JavaScript and Visual Studio Code to find the best route for a truck, car, or bicycle. The route is from the west coast of the USA, to the east coast. You will see how routes change based on vehicle. And, for trucks, how routes vary if the contents are hazardous. You will get the chance to add in your own locations.

value.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

value.title: Connecting IoT devices to Cognitive Services using Azure Functions
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Deploy a pre-built module to the Edge device
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Develop secure IoT Solutions for Azure Sphere with IoT Hub
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Develop secure IoT Solutions for Azure Sphere with IoT Central
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Get started with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This module will focus on the initial deployment of the Connected Field Service add-on for Dynamics 365 for Field Service.  The module will walk you through the installation and an understanding of the components installed as part of the out of the box template application.

value.title: Identify Exceptions with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This module will focus on the proactive detection of anomalies in the IoT device telemetry.  Additionally, this module will cover the customization of the Connected Field Service components to handle different telemetry from the device and options for storing detail data for future analysis.

value.title: Image classification using Azure Sphere
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Implement CI/CD for IoT Edge
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Ingest Data into Azure Digital Twins
value.excerpt: Learn the different ways to ingest data into Azure Digital Twins.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Sphere
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Introduction to Azure Functions for IoT
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Introduction to MLOps for IoT Edge
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Introduction to Azure Digital Twins
value.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure Digital Twins, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring digital twins to life for your organization and customers.

value.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
value.excerpt: Define a Logic Apps workflow declaratively as a Resource Manager template and deploy the app using the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI).

value.title: Call an API from a Logic Apps workflow using a custom connector
value.excerpt: In this module, learn to create a Logic Apps custom connector to call an API from a Logic Apps workflow.

value.title: Manage your Azure IoT Hub with alerts and metrics
value.excerpt: Learn about metrics, alerts, diagnostics, and logs. Create an Azure IoT Hub, an app to send vibration telemetry, and then create and test some metrics and alerts.

value.title: Monitor and manage your coffee machine with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure IoT Central application to control Internet of Things devices that communicate through unique connection strings.

value.title: Output from Azure Digital Twins to Downstream Services
value.excerpt: In this module, you will get to learn about how Azure Digital twins use event routes to send data to consumers outside the service.

value.title: Register and manage devices with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Register and Manage Customer Devices with Connected Field Service.

value.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.
